channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped waste, 14th June
item.description:
I’m flagging this because the current state of the woods is completely unacceptable. There is random rubbish dumped everywhere, and it’s beyond just a few items—this is a widespread mess that needs urgent attention. The area needs a proper walk-through. It’s not a huge space, but it’s been clearly neglected. The amount of waste is not only disgusting but also unsafe for the environment, the local wildlife, and for people and dogs using the area. I strongly suggest someone takes a proper walk through the site—you’ll see exactly what I’m talking about. This needs to be addressed now, not pushed down the line before it gets worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunkery Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Both ends of Murray Mews, 14th June
item.description:
The “no vehicles except for access” signs at each of Murray Mews frequently cause issues with taxi and delivery drivers refusing to drive to addresses in the street. Please add clarification that access to properties in the street is permitted so that this does not occur.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murray Mews, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Non cleaning of pathway Barfield Rd/Otford Close, 14th June
item.description:
I notice that street cleaning was due on Tuesday 10th June, however I believe that no cleaning has been done on the pavement area or curbside of Barfield Rd and Otford Close for some months now. There is rubbish, animal poo bags plastic etc which has not been collected or swept away and the area is very dirty. Please could you arrange that the street cleaners whether manual or mechanical vehicles attend our area when scheduled on your rosta.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Taryn Grove, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bamboo shoots breaking through tarmac pavement outside property, 14th June
item.description:
About a week ago (prior to 14/06) I noticed that a bulge (see pictures) had appeared in the pavement outside my property at 55 Nightingale Lane, BR1 2SA. On 13/06 I saw that bamboo shoots from a neighbouring property are the cause of the defect as there are 3 shoots pushing up through the pavement. Please could you take action to repair the pavement and (ideally) remove the bamboo as I am concerned that it will have spread further and start causing damage to my own property as well as council land. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nightingale Lane, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo on the alley between Melanie close and Brampton Road, 14th June
item.description:
The alley between Brampton Road and Melanie close (and leading onwards in the Melanie close) has so much dog poo that it is now impossible to ride a mobility scooter down it without getting it all on the wheels. Sometimes it’s picked up but the bags are left on the side of alley. This has been ongoing for months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Melanie Close, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
